Package org.apache.logging.log4j.async.logger.internal

Class AsyncLoggerDefaultBundle

java.lang.Object
org.apache.logging.log4j.async.logger.internal.AsyncLoggerDefaultBundle
public final class AsyncLoggerDefaultBundle extends Object
Provides default services for the per-context instance factory.

    @Named("AsyncLoggerConfig") com.lmax.disruptor.WaitStrategy
    defaultAsyncLoggerWaitStrategy(Configuration configuration, org.apache.logging.log4j.kit.env.PropertyEnvironment environment, @Named("StatusLogger") org.apache.logging.log4j.Logger statusLogger)
    The WaitStrategy for an AsyncLoggerConfig can be also configured in a configuration file, whereas the strategy for an AsyncLogger must be configured through properties only.

    • defaultAsyncLoggerWaitStrategy

      @Factory @Named("AsyncLoggerConfig") @ConditionalOnPresentBindings(bindings=org.apache.logging.log4j.core.config.Configuration.class) public @Named("AsyncLoggerConfig") com.lmax.disruptor.WaitStrategy defaultAsyncLoggerWaitStrategy(Configuration configuration, org.apache.logging.log4j.kit.env.PropertyEnvironment environment, @Named("StatusLogger") @Named("StatusLogger") org.apache.logging.log4j.Logger statusLogger)
      The WaitStrategy for an AsyncLoggerConfig can be also configured in a configuration file, whereas the strategy for an AsyncLogger must be configured through properties only.
      See Also:
      • asyncLoggerWaitStrategy(org.apache.logging.log4j.kit.env.PropertyEnvironment, org.apache.logging.log4j.Logger)
